dialogues.text: (continuing) That was two hundred and fifty years ago -- and the pain still scars your heart.  Would you live that pain again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) No.  What am I to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing you can do.  You must end it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod stands in a courtyard with Cavanaugh and Gaston. Macleod looks up the stone wall to a balcony.  Cavanaugh Gaston do not appear pleased to be there.  Macleod looks Cavanaugh who nods to him reassuringly.  Gaston looks aro nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a most dangerous undertaking. These are part of the royal apartments. Macleod begins to climb, grabbing onto rocks and sliding feet into the cervices.  He reaches the balcony and climb over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large and beautifully furnished.  A fire glows at the far of the room.  Isabelle sits before a dressing table and m combing her hair.  She is a beautiful woman in her late twenties.  In the mirror she sees Macleod as he enters th from the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conner. She smiles, then runs into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, blossom. She kisses him, then takes his hand starts to lead him in room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving in the morning. Isabelle is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving?  For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll no see me again. Isabelle's hurt and disappointment shows on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me, Conner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I'm going you cannot follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, it's for the best.  There are somethings that are better left unexplained. Macleod takes a ring off his finger.  IT IS THE SAME RING JENNIFER WAS WEARING.  He gently slips on Isabelle's fing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this -- and whenever you look at it, remember that it came from one who loved you. He kisses her forehead gently then starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to grow old with you -- to have your children. Macleod turns back to her and smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sad) I know, but that can never be, and that's the sorrow if it. He steps out onto the balcony and climbs over the railing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod drops to the ground.  Cavanaugh and Gaston are st waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. They start to leave.  TWO of the KING'S GUARDS approach t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your business here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Just taking in some night air, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated; correcting him) Corporal.  This is the King's cousins apartment.  Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we'll decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not. Macleod and Cavanaugh start to leave.  The GUARDS draw th swords.  Macleod and Cavanaugh turn and draw their swords Gaston is nervous.  He reaches under his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have permission.  I'll show you. Before he take out whatever he is reaching for one the GU thrusts his sword at Gaston.  In a flash, Macleod Samurai out and blocks the blade, stopping it inches before Gasto chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gaston) Go. Gaston has mixed feelings about leaving his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, go! Gaston leaves. A fight begins.  The Guards are not match the two immortals.  Cavanaugh quickly stabs one of the Gu in the arm.  He drops his sword and falls to the ground. Macleod battles with the other Guard.  He backs him up to wall, knocks his sword away and hold the tip of his Samur his throat.  A beat.  Anger fills Macleod's face as he de what to do. In the b.g. we HEAR the SOUND of FOOTSTEPS.  Macleod turn around to find that he and Cavanaugh are surrounded by TE GUARDS.  Macleod looks to Cavanaugh, who shakes his head,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, damp and dirty.  The floors a strewn with hay and garbage.  Macleod and Cavanaugh sits on the stone floor, backs to the wall.  The wounded Guard approaches the bars

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sentence has been passed on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only for attacking the King's guards.  Death.  You will both be executed immediately.  Which one of you shall go first? Macleod and Cavanaugh both stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) I'll go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stood up first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always get to go first. The guard is irritated by their cavalier attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will both go. (to Cavanaugh) You will go first. (to Macleod) And you will watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod and Cavanaugh are lead into the courtyard.  Their are tied behind their backs.  They are stopped before a t mechanical device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a guillotine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) What does it do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cuts your head off. Macleod and Cavanaugh exchange glances.  This isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cavanaugh) You can go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guard) Don't you have anything else?  Can't you hang us -- or shoot us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting's good.  I would much rather be shot.  This has to be awfully messy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Cavanaugh) Take him. Macleod and Cavanaugh begins to struggle, but it no use. hands are tied and there are far too many guards.  Macleo held back as Cavanaugh is forcefully placed under the bla beat.  The BLADE FALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) No! Cavanaugh's head falls into a basket.  The guards laugh a smile among themselves.  Macleod turns his attention to t guards -- his eyes are ice cold.  He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Macleod) Bring him. Before the guards can begin to move Macleod we HEAR a CRA SOUND.  Suddenly, Cavanaugh's body begins to hover above ground, streaks of green light flowing out of it.  Severa the guards cross themselves -- then Cavanaugh's energy is into Macleod. Macleod screams -- he effortlessly breaks his ropes.  He at the headless body with sadness, then jumps on a cart a climbs over the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness shows on Macleod's face as his mind slowly drifts the past back into the present.  He holds Jennifer's BUSI CARD in his hand, flicking it with his finger. Macleod walks over to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked POLICE CAR is down the street.  Greley is ins watching the shop. Macleod thinks for a moment.  He walks to a bookcase -- p out a book and presses a button.  A section of the bookca OPENS and leads to a staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod exits through a door into the alley.  We walks of the night. Jennifer steps out of a doorway down the alley and starts follow Macleod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod walks along rows of BROWNSTONES.  In the b.g. Jen steps around the corner, keeping her distance from Macleo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod walks -- thinks.  Suddenly he stops -- filled wit premonition.  He looks up and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are empty. Macleod reaches under his raincoat for the handle of his and starts walking.  As he reaches the corner we HEAR FOOTSTEPS.  Macleod stops -- waits. A UNIFORMED POLICE OFFICER turns the corner and walks tow him.  Macleod takes his hand out from his coat and walks him.  The instant the COP passes Macleod he turns  and re a SWORD from under his jacket. Jennifer watches helplessly. The cop smiles as he raises the sword over his head.  It GLIIMERS as the light from the STREET LIGHT reflects off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Macleod is walking away.  He hears her SCREAM and turns a just as the sword comes streaking at his head.  Macleod s steps the attack, the blade slices across his forearm, a of BLOOD appears on his arm.  Macleod quickly removes his Samurai from under his jacket. The cop studies him for a moment then begins to LAUGH.  A transformation begins and he turns into Kilvara. Jennifer's face is filled with disbelief from the sight s just witnessed. Kilvara smiles at Macleod, his eyes alive with hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highlander -- I had hoped it would be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) This cannot be. Kilvara says nothing.  He lunges at Macleod.  Their sword cross - sparks fly -- as the battle each other along the street.  Their sword cross and lock -- they grab each oth hands -- their faces inches from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am stronger than you, Highlander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the Kurgan said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kurgan was a pussy. Kilvara knees Macleod in the groin.  Macleod doubles over pushes forward, ramming his head in Kilvara's stomach -- pushing him backwards and slamming his back into a wall. LIGHTS begins to come on in the windows of the apartments Macleod runs off.  Kilvara follows.  Macleod runs around corner. Jennifer does not move.  She is trying to digest what she seen.  A beat, then she runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kilvara rounds the corner he sees Macleod waiting for his sword at his side.  Kilvara runs towards him, begins raise his sword then stops. We see why.  Behind Macleod is a CHURCH.  Kilvara lowers sword and looks at Macleod hatefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why prolong the inevitable? Macleod doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine -- I've waited over three centuries.  I can wait a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not by choice.  A small matter of a mountain falling down on us.  We were trapped inside. (serious) When the time of the Gathering came the urge to go was so strong we tried to claw through rock with our bare hands.  What you thought was the end -- was not.  This is the end.  We are the last of our kind, Macleod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will not end tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot hide from me.  You will not stand between me and my destiny. After I have your head the power will let me hold any form as long as I want.  Do you know what that means? I can become the President -- I can become anyone I want.  The world will be mine. Kilvara starts to leave.  He stops and turns back towards Macleod with a grin.  In the b.g. we see Jennifer crossin street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Macleod -- the next time you see me -- you won't see me. He LAUGHS as he walks off into the night.  Macleod stares him.  Jennifer crosses the street and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe what I just saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably the smartest thing. Macleod starts to walk away.  Jennifer notices the BLOOD arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  Why did he call you Macleod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who's Russell Nash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) I don't know anymore. Macleod walks off leaving her behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod sits on the couch, his mind deep in thought.  The is filled with antiques, momentos compiled over several lifetimes.  Rachel enters and sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have ended it tonight, but I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  He is the stronger one.  He has a power--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You also have a power, Conner.  It is why you have survived. Macleod looks at her, his eyes prompting her for the answ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart. Macleod feigns a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not underestimate the power of your heart.  Your dreams live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dreams died long ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they?  You are only a man, different than most -- but still a man.  You feel the same -- want the same.  You want to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't lived life -- I've hidden from it.  I've existed in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's time to come out of the shadows. Macleod looks at her fondly.  He cups his hand to her fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear, sweet, Rachel.  Men's lifes are measured by the good they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you search your heart you know all the good you have done.  Your strength comes from your heart -- because in your heart you know what you are fighting for is good and just. (points around the room) This room is filled with memories. If you search through them you can find the good -- the difference you have made.  And now, it is for you to make the greatest difference of all. Look in your heart, Conner -- and you will see the good that you have done. She looks at him warmly.  Macleod kisses her on the foreh She leaves the room.  A beat.  Macleod walks over to a ta filled with various objects.  One catches his eye.  He pi an old WALKING STICK.  Macleod closes his eyes -- his min drifts back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteenth century England. The East end.  The waterfront, cobblestone streets, gas l A thick fog hangs in the air.  Piano MUSIC drifts out of the pubs.  CROWDS of people hurry along the street. Among them is Macleod.  He is dressed in a suit like an E Gentleman and carries the ivory-handled WALKING STICK.  H walks slowly, through the crowd, seemingly oblivious to t people around him.  He comes to the mouth of an alley and stops, thinks, then enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden crates and stacks of garbage fill the alley.  Macl continues.  In the b.g. we HEAR the SOUNDS of a struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A middle-aged man, also dressed like an English Gentleman struggling with a PROSTITUTE.  He grabs her roughly and p her against the wall.  From inside his overcoat he slowly removes a long sword.  He holds the tip of the blade up b her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sir -- you're frightening me. This seems to please the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He smiles -- then just as quickly his smile fades.  He ap to sense something.  He turns around to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- just FOG -- then Macleod appears.  He stares a man. The Man stares at Macleod then smiles -- a wild, crazy sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (English accent) Conner -- what an unexpected surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't do that.  Just let me kill her and then we can attend to our business. Macleod takes a few steps closer.  He is now almost is st range.  He slowly slides his Samurai out of the walking s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you make your thrust at her I'll take your head.  It's her or me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear me -- I do so hate decisions. The man realizes that Macleod is right.  He reluctantly l her go.  The prostitute runs from the alley.  A beat.  Th men stare at each other -- then the Man lunges at Macleod swinging his sword furiously.  Sparks fly as sword cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Th Prostitute runs to the corner where she finds a CONSTA She hysterical gestures towards the alley.  The Constable follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Constable moves down the alley with the prostitute, e them carefully making their way through the fog.  As they the end of the alley the fog lifts. On the ground his the man -- his head severed from his bo The prostitute looks away -- the constable stares at the gruesome sight, his eyes filled with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear mother of God. In the b.g. Macleod steps out from behind a stack of crat He walks towards the street, disappearing in the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Macleod emerges onto the street we HEAR the SOUND of t constables POLICE WHISTLE.  As PEOPLE wander towards the to fill their curiosity, Macleod calmly walks across the street. An OLD MAN sits behind a wooden crate selling NEWSPAPERS. piece of paper is tacked to the crate displaying the days headline:  WHEN WILL THE RIPPER BE CAPTURED? Macleod looks at the headlines, the slowly turns and look at the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Goodbye -- Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe is looking over some papers as he eats a pastry. Detective Greley enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything from the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sent the prints we lifted from the counter at the bank to the State computers, the FBI and interpol. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to come from somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Greley looks at a printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked the State Department to check with our Embassies and Interpol to see if there were any similar occurrences like the bank.  Two weeks ago in London Charles Redder from the Bronx was mugged in Hyde Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- the only thing that was taken was his passport.  I checked with immigration -- he returned to New York ten days ago -- but our embassy in London says he is still there. Bedsoe thinks for a moment.  He looks up at Greley with a puzzled expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old and cluttered with books and artifacts.  Jennifer sit table examining some articles from the Scotland site.  Sh appears distant, her thoughts distracted.  Professor Dajo walks over to her and places a large BOOK on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going through some of my mythology books last night.  I think you'd get a kick out of this. She opens the book to where it is marked and begins to re What ever she is reading catches her interest.  She looks Dajorski amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod is with an ELDERLY WOMAN, showing her silver serv trays.  The woman can't decide on what to buy.  She thank Macleod and leaves.  As she walks through the door Jennif enters.  Macleod is both happy and annoyed with her arriv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a very persistent woman, Miss Hillman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer. Macleod stares at her.  It unnerves her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you stare at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remind me of someone I used to know. (beat) Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same story -- same questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any answers for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that man last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how did he know your name? Macleod shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always walk around with a sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York is dangerous place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to me -- but you don't answer my questions.  I guess I'll have to talk to Lieutenant Bedsoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It probably wouldn't interest you. It's something I read in a mythology book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm interested in mythology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of the Calan? Macleod expression shows that he has.  He stares at Jenni for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you have. Macleod smiles, his eyes pierce into hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Italian food? The change in conversation confuses her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me Tratino's at nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I'm interested in mythology.  We can talk about it more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kilvara walks down the street, still wearing his black ro Even in New York City his appearance draws attention.  He past a NEWSSTAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the cover of one of the TABLOIDS is a photograph of hi Kilvara looks up and notices the OWNER of the stand looki him.  Kilvara's eyes narrow and stare deeply into the man beat.  Kilvara walks away.  As he does the Man looks at t tabloid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kilvara enters and walks up the counter.  The SALESPERSON middle-aged man stares at him with disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to purchase a new jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man is holding the tabloid as he talks with TWO UNIFO POLICE OFFICERS and points down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Salesman holds up an expensive trench coat.  Kilvara studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks a bit small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tapered look is in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a lot of room.  Sometimes I carry things under my coat. The Salesman looks behind Kilvara -- something has caught attention.  Kilvara turns around following his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the POLICE OFFICERS crossing the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cops move towards the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should wait for backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be a big collar.  Why let the boys form robbery grab it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kilvara starts to walk to the door when the two cops ente their guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! Kilvara looks at them and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze.  A popular expression. In a flash Kilvara's grin fades.  His sword streaks out f under his jacket and slices through the first cops wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR several SHOTS being fired.  A beat -- then the WI of the store SHATTERS as the second cop comes flying thro -- Kilvara's sword impaled in his chest.  The cop crashes the ground -- dead.  Kilvara walks out, retrieves his swo walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe and Detective Greley watch as the bodies of the tw are loaded into the Medical Examiner's wagon.  Bedsoe wal over to the Salesman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shot him.  I saw it.  They shot him and he got right back up. Bedsoe pulls out the photograph of Kilvara and shows it t salesman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Bedsoe looks at the medical examiner's wagon as it drives His eyes are filled with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.  The LIGHTS from the buildings that surround the p fill the night sky.  Kilvara walks into frame.  Stops.  L out over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot hide from me, Macleod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark woods and leather.  Soft MUSIC plays in the b.g.  Je sits at a table alone, drinking second glass of wine.  Sh checks her watch.  From her expression it is obvious that Macleod is late.  We see Macleod enter and walk up behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) You're twenty minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Macleod takes off his overcoat and sits beside her.  On h is a BANDAGE covering the cut on his arm from Kilvara's b Macleod glances at her hand, his eyes focused on her ring Jennifer follows his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this ring mean something to you? The WAITER walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waiter) Glenmorganie -- no ice and...? Jennifer holds up her wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house red. The waiter smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't answer my question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. There is a moment of silence.  Jennifer appears uneasy. not good at small-talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an interesting accent. Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to place you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lived all over the world. She's aware that he is being evasive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not an easy person to get to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Because I don't give up all my secrets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you wanted to meet tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to get to know you better. His directness make her a little uncomfortable.  Macleod notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That makes you uncomfortable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little -- yes.  My interest in coming here is profession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  In the shop you mentioned something about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the Calan.  Do you know who they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were called different things by different cultures.  The Celts called them the Sourans.  The Druids called them the Calans.  According to the mythology they were spirits, sent to earth and reborn -- some good -- some evil -- both immortal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immortal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  They do not age and they cannot die -- unless their head is cut from their body. Macleod's face betrays nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Then the spirit is released and the power is absorbed by the Calan who severs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very interesting.  I bet kids love you at bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can explain what I saw the other night? Macleod ignores her question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you told Lieutenant Bedsoe your theory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't feel like sitting in a rubber room for forty-eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't really believe this do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sidesteps the question) Let me ask you something else.  At the excavation site in Scotland, the tunnel leading into the cavern had collapsed.  The day we found the body someone had moved the rocks, making a hole in the collapsed section.  What bothers me is that we found the rocks from the hole on our side of the tunnel wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would someone pull on the rocks to get in the cavern?  They were wedged in tight.  They couldn't get a grip on them.  They would have had much more strength pushing on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they pushed the rocks you would have found them on the other side of the cavern wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- if they were trying to get in -- but what if they weren't?  What if they were trying to get out? A beat.  Macleod isn't sure how much she knows -- but he she is close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would mean they'd been trapped in there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --for three hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could that be?  People don't live for three hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless they're immortal. Their eyes lock.  Macleod studies her.  He knows she know or at least suspects.  Jennifer smiles warmly, she places hand on Macleod arm -- then quickly tears the BANDAGE of arm.

dialogues.speaker: OF MACLEOD'S ARM
dialogues.text: There is no trace of the cut.  No scar -- nothing. Jennifer looks back at Macleod, astonished.  Macleod slow peels her hand off his arm.  His eyes stare deeply into h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very smart for someone who has not even lived a single lifetime. Maybe too smart. Macleod gets up and leaves.  Jennifer follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod walks down the street.  Jennifer runs after him. grabs him by the stop.  He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you mean a single lifetime? Are you saying that it's true? Macleod says nothing.  He stares at her for a moment, the walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.  Macleod walks along the pavement, his mind deep i thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer opens the door.  She is surprised to see Macleod beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in? Jennifer opens the door wider.  Macleod walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod walks to the middle of the room.  He is strugglin himself inside himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked me earlier if that ring meant something to me -- it does.  It reminds me of someone I knew a long time ago. Jennifer starts to take it off her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the back it has--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the crest of a lion and a dragon and a single word:  Courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know that? Macleod away -- his mind drifts as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came from your great, great, great grandmother, Isabelle Tourez, who lived in Paris and died on the guillotine in 1789 -- alone -- and unmarried.  The ring was given to her by someone who loved her -- but knew that it could never be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? Macleod looks at her, his eyes staring deeply into hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Now that she has heard what she suspected a look of doubt crosses her face.  Macleod notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born into the clan Macleod, five hundred years ago in Glenfinnan -- on the shores of Loch Shiel. Jennifer stares at him -- there is doubt in her eyes. Suspecting and believing are two different things and her expression relays her skepticism.  Macleod picks up a DAG the worktable and holds it before his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've wandered the world ever since then.  I cannot die. She tries to stop him, but before she can Macleod thrusts dagger into his chest.  His face fills with pain -- he dr his knees.  Jennifer watches in horror.  A beat.  Macleod up at her, then pulls the dagger from his chest.  Jennife overwhelmed with astonishment.  She slowly drops to her k They are inches from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) You wanted the truth -- now you have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other one -- he is like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is immortal -- yes -- but he is not like me.  We are the last of our kind. (he looks at her) The last of the Calans.  I do not know what purpose we were put here for.  I only know that if he wins the world will suffer for it. Macleod starts to stand.  Jennifer gently places her hand his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will end tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must you fight him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will not stop until it is over. Jennifer stares deeply into his eyes.  She moves closer a then, gently kisses him.  They search each others eyes. leans in to kiss him again.  Macleod pulls away.  She sta say something, he gently puts his finger over her lips an stares at her fondly -- then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod walks down the street towards the shop.  Suddenly out of a doorway Bedsoe appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it isn't.  A cop died today and the other is barely holding on.  I want some answers, Nash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that -- but I had nothing to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean you don't know what's going on.  You're connected to this guy somehow.  He's after you -- just like the others were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) It's late. Macleod starts to leave.  Bedsoe grabs him by the neck an slams him into the wall, then holds his GUN to Macleod's A beat.  Macleod stares at him calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years ago I interviewed a guy. He said he saw two men fighting in an alley with swords.  One cut off the others head.  He shot the surviving guy twenty times and he got right back up and stabbed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he was a lousy shot. Bedsoe anger fills Bedsoe's face.  He slowly pulls back t HAMMER of his pistol.  A beat.  He studies Macleod for a reaction.  There isn't one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people would show some sign of fear with a gun in their face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people are afraid of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people can die. A beat.  Their eyes are locked on each others, probing, studying, evaluating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you really believe that you'll pull the trigger. Bedsoe struggles within himself.  The gun shakes in his h A beat.  Slowly he lowers the pistol.  Macleod walks insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod sits on the couch, staring into the darkness.  Hi races, filled with thoughts and decisions.  He sharpens t blade of his Samurai.  The PHONE RINGS.  Macleod answers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you come out and play? Macleod doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  You know, some people think that I don't have any good qualities, but that isn't true.  I saw you tonight with your little friend -- I let you say goodbye to her.  I think of it as letting a condemned prisoner have his last request.  Besides, I have her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't part of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is now.  We're at the museum.  I figured we'd have more room for our business here.  If you hurry you might get here before I kill her. The line goes dead.  Macleod rushes from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod's PORSCHE races out of the parking lot and down t street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe is in his car.  He starts the engine and follows Macleod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod stops his car in front of the building. Bedsoe stops down the street and watches through the windshield. The front door is ajar.  Macleod opens it slowly and ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod holds his Samurai at his side as he walks down th corridor.  In the b.g we HEAR the SOUNDS of a struggle. Suddenly, Jennifer comes running down the hall towards hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here! She runs towards him, her face filled with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. Macleod starts to walk towards the room.  Jennifer walks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Conner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Conner? A flash of confusion fills Macleod's eyes -- his face har He swings around quickly and drives the blade on his swor Jennifer's chest.  She SCREAMS, a deep, unearthly SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe HEARS Jennifer's SCREAM.  He bolts out of his car runs towards the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain fills Jennifer's face.  A beat.  Slowly she smiles a TRANSFORMATION begins.  The image of Jennifer is replaced that of Kilvara.  Macleod smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never told her my first name. Kilvara grabs the blade and slowly pulls it from his ches Macleod swings his blade at Kilvara's neck.  Kilvara duck runs down the hall into the main room.  Macleod follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe reaches the front door.  He tries to break it open cannot.  He runs around the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macleod moves slowly through the work tables, waiting, watching, listening.  Something catches his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is gagged and tied to a chair which has been pla top of a long table.  Another chair has been placed about feet away from her on the table.  On the second chair a CROSSBOW has been mounted and aimed at Jennifer.  A ROPE tied to the TRIGGER and stretched to her chair.  A WEIGHT been tied in the center of the rope.  A CANDLE burns behi WEIGHT.  When it burns though the rope the WEIGHT will fa the CROSSBOW will fire at Jennifer. Kilvara steps out of the shadows, a wicked grin on his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clever -- don't you think.  You can save her.  All you have to do is blow out the candle.  Of course, you have to get past me to do it. The rope is beginning to turn black as the candle burns d into it.  Macleod knows he has little time before the rop snaps.  He moves towards her.  Kilvara blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you die. Kilvara swings his sword at Macleod.  Macleod blocks the attack.  Kilvara kicks him in the stomach, doubling him o and driving him back.  Kilvara wields his sword powerfull Macleod side-steps the attack -- Kilvara's blade slams in table, slicing it cleanly in half. Jennifer struggles in her chair, her eyes open wide in ho staring at the candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe reaches the back door.  It is locked also.  He goe to one of the windows and breaks it with the butt of his then climbs through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle continues.  Kilvara presses the attack, swingi sword furiously and relentlessly at Macleod.  Macleod jum on a table.  Kilvara swings his blade at Macleod's knees. Macleod jumps, the blade sails under his feet, when he la KICKS Kilvara in the face, knocking him to the ground. Kilvara's sword slides across the floor.  Macleod looks a Kilvara, then across the room.  He has only a second to d Kilvara or Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROPE is about to snap -- strands are staring to fray. Macleod runs across the tabletop and jumps onto another a heads for the long table across the room. Kilvara stands -- picks up his sword and runs after Macle More strands of the rope snap as the flame burns deeper i rope.  It is just about to when... Macleod runs onto the long table.  He dives and slides ac it -- his Samurai extended in front of him. The rope SNAPS.  The WEIGHT begins to fall. Macleod drives the blade of his sword through the trigger housing.  The WEIGHT pulls on the rope -- but the blade o Samurai blocks the trigger from pulling back. Kilvara reaches Macleod.  Their eyes meet.  Macleod knows cannot removes his sword to defend himself or the crossbo fire.  Kilvara raises his sword and is about to strike wh SHOT is FIRED. Bedsoe is standing in the doorway, his gun aimed at Kilva

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kilvara) You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -- freeze. A beat.  Kilvara looks at Bedsoe, then at Macleod.  He is a few feet away.  He thinks -- then lunges at Macleod. Bedsoe fires two shots.  They hit Kilvara in the chest. drops to the ground. Macleod unties Jennifer quickly.  Bedsoe moves across the towards them.  He carefully passes the motionless body of Kilvara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedsoe -- he isn't dead! Too late.  Kilvara stands, grabbing Bedsoe guns hand.  He smashes it against the wall.  The GUN flies out of Bedsoe hand and slides across the floor.  Kilvara effortlessly l him off the ground and throws him against the wall.  Beds hist the floor hard, his face etched in pain from several broken bones.  Jennifer runs over to him. Kilvara picks up his sword and moves towards Macleod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- we finish it. Macleod stares at him confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Macleod quickly spins the chair with the CROSSBOW around is facing Kilvara.  He removes his Samurai.  The trigger back. WHOOSH!  The ARROW hits Kilvara in the chest.  Pain fills face. Macleod runs towards him.  Kilvara pulls the arrow from h chest and manages to raises his sword just in time to blo Macleod's attack.  Through the room they battle.  Macleod fights fiercely backing Kilvara up. Jennifer makes Bedsoe more comfortable by propping him ag the wall.  She looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Bedsoe's gun on the floor. Jennifer rushes over to it and picks it up.  She aims it Kilvara. Kilvara sees her with the gun.  He knows that if she shoo he would be stunned along enough for Macleod to take his Jennifer FIRES a SHOT.  It misses -- the bullet hits the Kilvara swings his sword powerfully at one of the WOODEN PILLARS.  His blade slices through it.  Part of the ROOF collapses. DUST fills the room.  SILENCE.  Jennifer slowly moves for trying to see through it.  The dust clears.  She stops -- stunned and confused by what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the middle of the room are TWO MACLEOD'S. Jennifer moves the gun back and forth between each of the noting knowing which is the real Macleod. Both Macleod's look at each other.  They lunges at each o and the battle begins again. Jennifer can only watch helplessly. Through the room they fight -- both Macleod's swinging th swords at the other -- their swords cross -- sparks fly. move through the room -- fighting fiercely. One of the Macleod's swings his sword -- it slices throug other arm.  The other Macleod's drops his sword.  The fir Macleod raises his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There can be only one. He swings the sword, slicing it across the other Macleod' neck.  A beat.  Out the gash come a brilliant GREEN LIGHT then the transformation begins.  The image of Macleod fad is replaced by Kilvara.  He stares at Macleod, tries to s but falls to the floor and dies. A beat.  Macleod readies himself.  The place explodes in burst of GREEN LIGHT.  Windows explode, overhead lights f on and off then blow up. Jennifer and Bedsoe shield their eyes from the brilliant spectacle. Macleod's body pulses with pain as Kilvara's power flows him. SILENCE.  Macleod drops to his knees.  Jennifer rushes ov him and helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it over. For a moment it is as if he didn't hear the question, the slowly he looks at her.  He picks up his Samurai and slow slices the blade into the palm of his hand.  A cut appear beat.  It does not heal.  Macleod looks at her with a tra grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- somebody want to gimme a hand here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars fill the street.  Macleod stands on the side with Jennifer.  Detective Greley stands behind them.  Two PARAMEDICS wheel Bedsoe out on a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant -- what about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I take him in? Bedsoe looks at Macleod who is waiting to see what Bedsoe going to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it was self defense. Macleod nods at Bedsoe -- without words a quiet understan is reached between them.  Bedsoe looks angrily at the paramedics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we gonna wait here for my bones to heal -- or you gonna take me to the hospital? They wheel him to the ambulance. Macleod starts to walk away.  Jennifer walks beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I can start to live.  To feel. To grow old and live each day without the promise of another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds very -- normal. Macleod smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- yes it does. He puts his arm around her and they walk off together.
